description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmbb2","text":"This is the pipeline used to process data for the RatGTEx Portal. It is loosely based on the GTEx eQTL mapping pipeline, though it includes some utility scripts from there in their entirety. All code for this pipeline can be found in the repository. It is built on Snakemake, a Python-based framework for reproducible data analysis. The commands reproduced here use Snakemake-style templating, with variables in brackets to represent different input/output file names and parameters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":14},{"key":1,"offset":93,"length":26},{"key":2,"offset":238,"length":10},{"key":3,"offset":265,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A1A40EDFB52D11ECB0900A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://ratgtex.org"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F85ADC30B52E11EC8E94AF80DAB48BD1","url":"https://github.com/broadinstitute/gtex-pipeline"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CCB543F0B52D11EC8E94AF80DAB48BD1","url":"https://github.com/daniel-munro/ratgtex-pipeline"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A1A40E46B52D11ECB0900A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://snakemake.github.io"}}}}

funders.funder_name: National Institute of General Medical Sciences
National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism

keywords: rat, eQTL, gene expression, RNA-Seq, rodent, outbred

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a1i06","text":"Generate the index for STAR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pikp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"kn4q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eendj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b443k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":0,"developer":null,"guid":"7DCD6020B46911ECABCE552A7C137669","id":1362,"link":"https://github.com/alexdobin/STAR","name":"STAR","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"repository":null,"version":"2.7.9a"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10275,"name":"STAR --runMode genomeGenerate \\\n    --genomeDir {params.outdir} \\\n    --genomeFastaFiles {input.fasta} \\\n    --sjdbGTFfile {input.gtf} \\\n    --sjdbOverhang {params.overhang} \\\n    --runThreadN {resources.cpus}","os_name":"","os_version":null,"command_name":"STAR index","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"05CC2240B46A11ECABCE552A7C137669"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmsa","text":"Align RNA-Seq reads for a sample using STAR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aiocq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"foh5v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buhrq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ccs7c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":0,"developer":null,"guid":"669F6D20B46A11ECABCE552A7C137669","id":1362,"link":"https://github.com/alexdobin/STAR","name":"STAR","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"repository":null,"version":"2.7.9a"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10276,"name":"STAR --runMode alignReads \\\n        --runThreadN {resources.cpus} \\\n        --genomeDir {params.index_dir} \\\n        --readFilesIn {params.fastq_list} \\\n        --readFilesCommand zcat \\\n        --twopassMode Basic \\\n        --varVCFfile \u003c(zcat {input.vcf}) \\\n        --waspOutputMode SAMtag \\\n        --quantMode TranscriptomeSAM \\\n        --outSAMstrandField intronMotif \\\n        --outSAMattrRGline {params.read_groups} \\\n        --outSAMtype BAM SortedByCoordinate \\\n        --outSAMunmapped Within \\\n        --outFileNamePrefix {params.prefix}","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"STAR align","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"9CCB6070B46A11ECABCE552A7C137669"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5n18","text":"Get an individual-specific VCF file. This is used by STAR to consider the individual's variants for better alignment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"926v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv7q4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dr4s7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c86mo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eoqn7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":0,"developer":null,"guid":"263A2D50B46B11ECABCE552A7C137669","id":1293,"link":"https://github.com/samtools/bcftools","name":"bcftools","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"repository":"https://github.com/samtools/bcftools","version":"1.12"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10277,"name":"bcftools view -s {wildcards.rat_id} --min-ac=1 -O z -o {output} {input}","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"bcftools view","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"48BD2B20B46B11ECABCE552A7C137669"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"625sl","text":"Get all exon regions from gene annotations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gvp7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"odh6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aba66","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10278,"name":"grep -v '^#' {input} | awk '$3==\"exon\"' | cut -f1,4,5 | gzip -c \u003e {output}","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"Exons from GTF annotations","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"0817FC20B46C11ECABCE552A7C137669"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rf73","text":"Count reads with REF vs. ALT allele in a sample for each SNP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i499","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dpkk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i3or","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ijpa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":1,"developer":null,"guid":"FCE3D4E0B46C11ECABCE552A7C137669","id":1400,"link":null,"name":"gatk","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"repository":null,"version":null}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10281,"name":"gatk ASEReadCounter \\\n    -R {input.ref} \\\n    -I {input.bam} \\\n    -V {input.vcf} \\\n    -O {output} \\\n    --min-depth-of-non-filtered-base 10 \\\n    --min-mapping-quality 250 \\\n    --min-base-quality 15","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"ASEReadCounter","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"167DA250B46D11ECABCE552A7C137669"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"biud5","text":"Compare similarity of genotypes and allele counts from RNA-Seq to identify mixups.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84sm9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqtp3","text":"qc_rna_to_geno_similarity.py","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ilq3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sskc","text":"Produces a matrix of RNA-Seq samples x VCF individuals giving similarity across the test SNPs. Similarity is mean(1 - abs(RNA_frac - geno_frac)), where RNA_frac is fraction of reads with ALT allele for each SNP, and geno_frac is fraction of DNA strands with ALT allele (i.e. 0, 0.5, or 1) for each SNP. Also produces a summary table with top similarity per RNA-Seq sample to quickly check for mismatches.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F7D8D3A0B46D11ECABCE552A7C137669","url":"https://github.com/daniel-munro/ratgtex-pipeline/blob/92dace364210a6810aa36847de7ac676b795d626/src/qc_rna_to_geno_similarity.py"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4a80t","text":"For samples without a genotype match, check for matches in all rats.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hlvm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jboi","text":"qc_rna_to_geno_all_rats.py","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":26}],"data":{}},{"key":"ecgr4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nft5","text":"After running the previous step, some mismatched RNA samples might still not have a genotype match. This rule will compare their test SNPs to those of all 6000+ rats we have genotypes for to see if any match. It's good to also include at least one RNA sample ID that did match as a positive control (as long as it's included in the all-rat VCF).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"30877A30B46E11ECABCE552A7C137669","url":"https://github.com/daniel-munro/ratgtex-pipeline/blob/92dace364210a6810aa36847de7ac676b795d626/src/qc_rna_to_geno_all_rats.py"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"981if","text":"Examine the outputs to identify samples that need to be relabeled (e.g. if two labels get swapped) or removed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egptr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t2jr","text":"To relabel a sample, edit the ID in the 2nd column of fastq_map.txt for all of its FASTQ files so that its BAM file gets labeled correctly. You'll then need to regenerate the BAM file since it will now use the correct VCF individual as input to STAR.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dtm3","text":"To remove a sample, remove its ID from rat_ids.txt and delete its BAM and any other generated files.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8e3f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s1pg","text":"If a match is found with a rat outside the current dataset in the previous step, you'll need to add the new matching genotypes to the VCF file. However, if the matching genotypes differ greatly from the current dataset, e.g. they include a very different set of SNPs, it may be better to just remove the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31j24","text":"Map cis-eQTLs, determining significance using permutations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rgur","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8icpj","text":"Outputs the top association per gene. This script calls tensorQTL and uses the random_tiebreak parameter, which is important for outbred populations in which there are often multiple top eSNPs in 100% LD. Without the random tiebreak, the first or last tied top SNP is returned, resulting in positional bias.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al8fn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"42spj","text":"run_tensorqtl.py","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":16}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0a12","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5veh7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":1,"developer":null,"guid":"8B9A80C0B47311ECABCE552A7C137669","id":1403,"link":null,"name":"tensorQTL","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"repository":null,"version":null}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D4300BC0B47311ECABCE552A7C137669","url":"https://github.com/daniel-munro/ratgtex-pipeline/blob/92dace364210a6810aa36847de7ac676b795d626/src/run_tensorqtl.py"}},"2":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10293,"name":"python3 src/run_tensorqtl.py \\\n    {params.geno_prefix} \\\n    {input.bed} \\\n    {output} \\\n    --covariates {input.covar} \\\n    --mode cis","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"C4EE19E0B47311ECABCE552A7C137669"}}}}
